subject: Re: [junit] Proper use of TestReult
msgSnippet: ... Not necessarily. Take a look at the code I posted in my original message. There is a loop in there that repeats the same operation over and over. If I do 4
messageBody:
On 18 Sep, Brian C. Robinson wrote:
> At 07:50 AM 9/17/01, you wrote:
>>My problem with the 4 tests approach is that if for some reason the public
>>API for the tests change, I have to change n+1 test methods. Whereas if I
>>contain everything in a single test (as I'm doing now) I only have to
>>change it once when the public API changes (and yes, it has happened).
>
> Shouldn't the 4 tests each be about 1/4 the size of the one big test?
>

Not necessarily. Take a look at the code I posted in my original message.
There is a loop in there that repeats the same operation over and over. If I
do 4 tests instead of one, the only code that disapears is the loop setup
and execution. Everything else remains the same.

L

--
Laurent Duperval <mailto:lduperval@...>

L'homme du monde bien entraîné peut toujours faire face à l'improvisation et
sidère ses contemporains éblouis par sa faculté de fulgurer quand il le faut!
Donc, je fulgure...
-Achille Talon
